articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Judges at the top United Nations court ordered Israel on Friday to halt its military assault on the southern Gaza city of Rafah.
articles.title: World Court orders Israel to halt assault on Gaza's Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 300 people and over 1,100 houses were buried by a massive landslide that levelled a remote village in northern Papua New Guinea, local media reported on Saturday.
articles.title: More than 300 buried in Papua New Guinea landslide, local media says

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China ended two days of war games around Taiwan, in which it simulated attacks with bombers and practiced boarding ships, and Taiwan's defence ministry detailed on Saturday the surge of Chinese warplanes and warships involved.
articles.title: China ends war games, Taiwan details warplane, warship surge

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is ready to halt the war in Ukraine with a negotiated ceasefire that recognises the current battlefield lines, four Russian sources told Reuters, saying he is prepared to fight on if Kyiv and the West do not respond.
articles.title: Exclusive: Putin wants Ukraine ceasefire on current frontlines

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stepped up military strikes on Gaza on Friday, residents and medics said, with heavy fighting reported in Jabalia in the north and tanks pushing further into Rafah in the south.
articles.title: Heavy fighting in northern Gaza, Israeli tanks advance further in Rafah

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: The world's largest election may become the hottest on Saturday, as Indians participate in the next-to-last phase of voting with temperatures forecast to surge to 47 degrees Celsius (117 degrees Fahrenheit) in the capital New Delhi.
articles.title: India's massive election faces heatwave challenge in penultimate phase

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A preliminary report by Iran's military said no evidence of foul play or attack had been found so far during investigations into the helicopter crash that killed President Ebrahim Raisi, state media reported on Friday.
articles.title: No sign of foul play in Iran president's deadly helicopter crash, early report says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday that Ukrainian forces had secured "combat control" of areas where Russian troops staged an incursion this month in northern parts of Kharkiv region.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukrainian forces control area of Russia push into Kharkiv region

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli ministers dismissed Friday's ruling by the International Court of Justice ordering Israel to cease its military operation in the southern Gaza city of Rafah, vowing to continue fighting to free its hostages and defeat Hamas.
articles.title: Israel defiant after World Court ruling

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Azerbaijan's border service has taken control of four villages in the Gazakh district on the border with Armenia under an agreement struck with Yerevan, Azerbaijani Deputy Prime Minister Shahin Mustafayev said on Friday.
articles.title: Azerbaijan takes control of four villages on border with Armenia as part of deal
